Package edu.waketech.academic

Class Course

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.waketech.academic.Course
  • public class Course
extends java.lang.Object
    The representation of a Course at Wake Tech.

    The general concept of a course is that it has a roster of students. For each of these students, there is a list of Assignmemts. This list of Assignments may have multiple Assignments with identical names, as a student may attempt an Assignment multiple times.

    In addition to a roster of students with their assignments, a Course has a String department name (such as "CSC" or "DBA") and an int course number (such as 151 or 120).

    The course roster is a Map<Integer, List<Assignment>>, where the key is the student's id number.

    Author:
    parks

      • Course

        public Course​(int courseNumber,
              java.lang.String department)
        Create a Course with a given courseNumber and department Note that a course number must be a positive number, and the department name must be non-null. Otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        courseNumber - the course number, such as 151 or 251
        department - the department offering the course, such as CSC or DBA

      • Course

        public Course​(java.lang.String department,
              int courseNumber)
        See Course(courseNumber, department). Only the parameters have been reversed
        Parameters:
        department - the department offering the course, such as CSC or DBA
        courseNumber - the course number, such as 151 or 251

    • Method Detail

      • addStudent

        public boolean addStudent​(int studentId)
        Add a student to this course roster. Students are identified in courses only by id.
        Parameters:
        studentId - to be added to this course
        Returns:
        true if the roster of students was changed as part of this method call, false otherwise.

      • addAssignment

        public void addAssignment​(int studentId,
                          Assignment assignment)
        Add a given assignment for a given student to this course Note that the assignment must be non-null. Otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        studentId - identifier of the student related to this assignment
        assignment - containing the grade for this student

      • getAssignmentsForStudent

        public java.util.List<Assignment> getAssignmentsForStudent​(int studentId)
        Scan this Course for all assignment related to a given Student
        Parameters:
        studentId - identifier of the student whose assignments are requested
        Returns:
        all the assignments related to the given student, or an empty list.

      • getAssignment

        public java.util.List<Assignment> getAssignment​(int studentId,
                                                java.lang.String assignmentName)
        Find the particular Assignments for a particular Student. It is possible that a given Assignment has multiple attempts, and each of them will be returned.
        Parameters:
        studentId - identifier of the Student
        assignmentName - the name of the Assignment
        Returns:
        the assignments with the given name and student

      • getStudentsForAssignment

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<Assignment>> getStudentsForAssignment​(java.lang.String assignmentName)
        Given an Assignment, list the Student attempts. See getAssignment for how a given assigment may have multiple attempts
        Parameters:
        assignmentName - the name of the assignment whose attempts are to be returned
        Returns:
        the students attempting the given Assignment, with their resulting results

      • getAllAssignmentNames

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllAssignmentNames()
        Return, in alphabetical order, all assignment names known to this course. Sorting should be by last name, then first name, then student id.
        Hint: Use a data structure that will automatically sort and remove duplicate entries
        Returns:
        sorted list of all assignment names known to this course

      • filterRoster

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<Assignment>> filterRoster​(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Integer> studentFilter,
                                                                                java.util.function.Predicate<Assignment> assignmentFilter)
        Filter the roster based on a student filter AND an assignment filter.
        Note that this method is optional. If you choose not to provide it, simply return new HashMap<Integer, List<Assignment>>();
        Parameters:
        studentFilter - identifies the Students to be considered for this filter
        assignmentFilter - identifies the Assignment to be considered for this filter
        Returns:
        the Students with the Assignments that pass both the Student and Assignment filters.
